# Problem Statement:
![q6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53595853/135751543-4745219f-6022-4ac8-871b-6f9ac70d6a83.png)

## Solution:
This challenge came with a public RSA key.
```
-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----

Ia54t6o2+2vXKYfQgSwjeXRBywgglQ==
-----END PUBLIC KEY-----

```
The challenge states that I had to find the decryption exponent.
So I put RSACtfTool to work again.

First to find the private key
```
$ python3 RsaCtfTool.py --publickey ./mykey.pub --private

[*] Testing key ./mykey.pub.
[*] Performing mersenne_primes attack on ./mykey.pub.
 29%|██████████████████████▎                                                     | 15/51 [00:00<00:00, 45491.37it/s]
[*] Performing system_primes_gcd attack on ./mykey.pub.
100%|███████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 7007/7007 [00:00<00:00, 272986.82it/s]
[*] Performing fibonacci_gcd attack on ./mykey.pub.
100%|████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 9999/9999 [00:00<00:00, 31045.62it/s]
[*] Performing pastctfprimes attack on ./mykey.pub.
100%|█████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 113/113 [00:00<00:00, 234631.86it/s]
[*] Performing factordb attack on ./mykey.pub.
[*] Attack success with factordb method !

Results for ./mykey.pub:

Private key :

```

Then to find the value of d from the private key
```
$ python3 RsaCtfTool.py --dumpkey --key ./mykey2.pub 
private argument is not set, the private key will not be displayed, even if recovered.
n: 
e: 
d: 6393313697836242618414301946448995659516429576261871356767102021920538052481829568588047189447471873340140537810769433878383029164089236876209147584435733
p: 
q: 

```
I found the value of d and hence retrieved the flag.
